column4: after downloaded the UCoC and running  gpg --clearsign UbuntuCodeofConduct-1.1.txt in terminal and enter my passphrase i get a error. can anyone please help?
what error ?
file open error, no such file directory, gpg angent not availabel in this session
is the file in your home folder? or maybe you downloaded it to Desktop ?
it was in download folder then, i got the msg, so i tried it  with file  on my desktop, then i chaged the name of the file  too. nothing has worked
have you generated your keys ?
yes i have
as far as i know,... it shows on my profile  now anyways...
do « ls -l Ubuntu* && gpg --clearsign UbuntuCodeofConduct-1.1.txt » paste the output on a pastebin
one sec
ok i  ran the terminal ya asked for  i got cannot access no such file  or directory
so the file is not there? find it and cd to where the file is
its in downloads folder
so go there. « cd Downloads » (keep in mind linux is case sesitive
um... out of no reason it just worked... for a second  i began to worry i misspeled my passhrase.
wot i was doing was  right clicking  in downloads folder and  open in terninal  it asked for my passphrase  i kept getting the error..
ok ;) something weird happens with the open terminal here then ...
you can change it if you want
after seeing  1 how its displayed 2 learning wot gpg/pgp is yes i'd like to change it....
now i cant open that output file...
in Aplications>Accesories>(keys and passwords)Seahorse
go to second tab right click on your keypair choose properties. in the first tab there is a button to change passphrase
oh thanks i see it...i cannot open the file output by the terminal command. there is no application installed for  PGP/MIME-encrypted message header files???? wot am i not doing  right?
